caption: Table 1: General Performance. Average accuracy and F-1 score of 5 independent runs are reported.
description: This table presents the average accuracy and F1-score achieved by different data augmentation methods across three IoT sensing applications (Human Activity Recognition, Vehicle Detection, and Harmful Brain Activity Recognition).  Two downstream models (DeepSense and Transformer) were used for each application. The methods are categorized into three groups: No Augmentation, Fine-grained Controllable Generative Augmentation (the proposed method), and Traditional Data Augmentation.  The results show the performance improvement obtained by using the proposed method compared to traditional methods and label-only conditional generative models.

caption: Table 2: Ablation Studies. Results with 95% confidence interval.
description: This table presents the ablation study results, showing the impact of removing each category of metrics (time domain, frequency domain, and time-frequency domain) on the overall performance.  The results are reported as accuracy (Acc) and F1-score (F1) for three different IoT sensing applications: Human Activity Recognition, Vehicle Detection, and Harmful Brain Activity Recognition.  The 95% confidence interval is included for each metric and application.
